title: Three Men Charged In Connection To Trinity Gay's Death
content:
Lexington police say three men are facing charges in connection to the death of 15-year-old Trinity Gay. Gay was shot at killed early Sunday morning after she was hit by a stray bullet during a shooting at Cookout restaurant on Broadway. Trinity Gay is the daughter of Olympian and Lexington native Tyson Gay.
Police say 21-year-old Dvonta Middlebrooks is charged with wanton endangerment and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. According to the arrest citation, investigators determined that Middlebrooks was in the parking lot and fired multiple shots at the time of the incident.
38-year-old Chazerae M. Taylor and 19-year-old D'markeo C. Taylor are also each charged with wanton endangerment in connection to the incident. Officers say the two men are father and son.
Police have also recovered a second vehicle, a blue Ford passenger car, which was described by a witness as leaving the scene of the shooting.
Anyone with any information on the shooting is asked to call Lexington Police.
